column4: hello. Can anyone tell me if there is a software set for linux (free) that does all that BeLarc services do ?

they manage computers, networks, find security problams, from the way it reads it is an IT tool for manageing a network
ill look into it now. Thanks
to open the man page for bash (for example), you do « man bash ».  You can scroll with arrow keys and quit with 'q'
you can also search with /search_term_here<enter>.  And then cycle results with 'n' and 'N'
heres the sad part .. is there a way to find the proper manual
can you link to what you are reading?
then I would try the cobbler man page :) http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/precise/man1/cobbler.1.html
thanks ... how did you find it so fast ?
